page.title: 03The Dymock Poets 1911-1914
page.content: The Dymock poets is the name given to a famous group of poets who lived in the area between 1911 and 1914. Lascelles Abercrombie was the first to arrive. He came first to Much Marcle before settling down in Dymock in 1911. He lived in The Gallows in Ryton. He was joined by Wilfred Wilson Gibson, Rupert Brooke, John Drink _ water and Edward Thomas. They published poems, many of them about this area, in news letters which went out all over the world. The group broke up when World War 1 began in August 1914. Both Rupert Brooke and Edward Thomas were killed in the War.
